newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid stocks bump lower as traders take profits.
newsitem.headline: Madrid stocks bump lower as traders take profits.

text.p: Madrid stocks ended sharply lower on Tuesday, tracking major markets overseas, as profit-taking continued in thinner than usual volume, dealers said.
However the slide did not cause too much concern, and most thought gains could ensue once the market has taken a breather.
The general index fell 6.54 points, 1.13 percent, to 571.84 and the Ibex-35 shed 83.39 points, 1.26 percent, to 6,543.81.
The biggest stocks saw sharp losses, especially banks, after hefty gains this year. BBV slipped 2.2 pct to 11,090, Santander shed 2.1 pct to 4,345.
"There nothing new in this, it's simply profit-taking after a good run this year and inspired by U.S. inflation coming in line with expectations," said a Spanish bank dealer.
Much of today's volume was accounted by put-throughs, and there were few final investors in the market, he added.
Telefonica shed 75 pesetas to 4,255 in thinner trade than usual despite an upgraded recommendation from Lehman Brothers.
Gas Natural was one of few gainers, adding 280 pesetas to 30,550, a technical movement after recent losses, and also ahead of Wednesday's shareholders' meeting, analysts said.
